intro: Holodiscus fissus, commonly known as the fissured holodiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often deeply lobed. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, rounded clusters. It typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
